title: AI and Deep Learning for Terahertz Ultra-Massive MIMO: From Model-Driven Approaches to Foundation Models
authors: Wentao Yu, Hengtao He, Shenghui Song, Jun Zhang, Linglong Dai, Lizhong Zheng, Khaled B. Letaief
summary: The study investigates AI's potential to address challenges in terahertz ultra-massive MIMO systems, proposing three research roadmaps for developing tailored AI algorithms.
key_points: Model-driven deep learning and channel state information foundation models

title: Recent Advances of 6G Ultra-Massive MIMO Technologies in Spatial and Beam Domains
authors: Rui Feng, Cheng-Xiang Wang, Jie Huang, Xiqi Gao
summary: This paper investigates ultra-massive MIMO channel characteristics, focusing on spatial-temporal transmission and random access technologies. It reviews recent advances and introduces the beam domain as a solution to high dimensional complexity.

title: ADAPTIVE BEAMFORMING AND MASSIVE MIMO OPTIMIZATION FOR ULTRA-RELIABLE LOW-LATENCY COMMUNICATION (URLLC) IN 6G NETWORKS
summary: This study investigates adaptive beamforming and massive MIMO optimization methods for Ultra-Reliable Low-Latency Communications (URLLC) in 6G networks, aiming to enhance reliability, latency, and spectral efficiency.
key_points: Adaptive beamforming improves end-to-end delay by up to 40%
Massive MIMO increases spatial diversity gains
Robustness to mobile user motion and interference is enhanced
Closed-form solution for holistic optimization of cross-layer adaptive beamforming
